DOC.brief_title: Interventions Control Obesity Community Colleges ( CDC WAY Health )
DOC.detailed_description: Despite fact obesity epidemic proportion cost US employer estimate $ 78.5 billion annually ; national data indicate less 25 % employer offer disease management program address obesity . Effective weight loss program adaptable busy work environment maintain employee interest need , rigorous test program attempt . In collaboration North Carolina Community College System , NC Blue Cross Blue Shield , State Health Plan Teachers State Employees , three year group-randomized weight loss intervention study approximately 1020 overweight/obese employee nest within 17 community college . Campuses randomly assign receive one three promising , state-of-the-art , theory-linked intervention : Environment/Usual Care ( E ) ; Web-based Weight Loss Program + Environment ( WEB+E ) Web + Environment +Incentives ( WEB+E+I ) . College unit randomization intervention ; employee unit analysis . Follow-up weigh-in assessment complete 3 , 6 , 12 month . After formative research Year 1 adapt intervention community college employee , effect intervention rigorously test 12-month weight loss ( primary outcome ) . Most secondary outcome ( weight loss behavior , moderate-vigorous physical activity ; total calorie , percent body fat , fruit/vegetable intake , absenteeism , productivity , medical expenditure , quality life ) assess baseline , 6 12 month ; along potential mediators/moderators weight loss outcome . Process track data measure fidelity , dose delivered/received acceptability/satisfaction intervention . Extensive cost- cost-effectiveness analysis , include return investment , undertaken . If proven effective , strong partnership community college , State Health Plan , research team , help guide program adoption institutionalization/dissemination throughout community college campus system .
